battleship2000.programlogic.control

Class PlayOneRound

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship2000.programlogic.control.PlayOneRound
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller

    public class PlayOneRound
extends Object
implements Controller
    This controller class is responsible for the actions of a single round, where every player bombs an enemy square and is rewarded points for it.
    Author:
    Petri

    • Constructor Summary

      In the constructor the user's choice of square to bomb is given as a parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayOneRound

        public PlayOneRound(BattleShipGame game,
            Square usersChoice)
        In the constructor the user's choice of square to bomb is given as a parameter. Thus the user's choice must be already made before a new PlayOneRound object can be instantiated.
        Parameters:
        game - the BattleShipGame
        usersChoice - the pre-made choice of which square to bomb

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public Object execute()
        Starts the round and performs needed actions.

        One round consists of the following actions done for each of the game's players:

        1. The users choice of square is bombed, points added to the player
        2. The users hit or miss count is incremented according to the result of bombing the square
        3. The game's LogicObservers are notified
        4. Check if the player won the game
          • If the player won, the game ends
          • Otherwise the game continues

        Note! If one of the players wins the game, the game ends immediately and all the remaining players' turns are not played.

        Specified by:
        execute in interface Controller
        Returns:
        0 (irrelevant)
